meanings.definition: To relieve of boredom or tedium.
meanings.sent1: I always play games to unbore myself.
meanings.sent2: She watched a movie to unbore herself.
meanings.sent3: The funny clown tried to unbore the audience with his jokes.
meanings.sent4: Music has the power to unbore even the most restless minds.
meanings.sent5: The exciting adventure book will surely unbore you.

meanings.sent1: The lively music made the party atmosphere unbore.
meanings.sent2: He felt unbore during the engaging conversation.
meanings.sent3: The colorful decorations made the room feel unbore.
meanings.sent4: Her vibrant personality always keeps things unbore.
meanings.sent5: The thrilling roller coaster ride left them feeling unbore.
